metadata.title: CVE-2024-35930 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:lpfc: Fix possible memory leak in lpfc_rcv_padisc() The call tolpfc_sli4_resume_rpi() in lpfc_rcv_padisc() may return an unsuccessfulstatus. In such cases, the elsiocb is not issued, the completion is notcalled, and thus the elsiocb resource is leaked. Check return value aftercalling lpfc_sli4_resume_rpi() and conditionally release the elsiocbresource.

criterions.comment: linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
